definition: to follow the trend
to overtake/to catch up with/to hurry/to rush/to try to catch (the bus etc)/to drive (cattle etc) forward/to drive (sb) away/to avail oneself of (an opportunity)/until
wave/breaker/unrestrained/dissipated/to stroll/to ramble
suffix for nouns
head/hair style/the top/end/beginning or end/a stub/remnant/chief/boss/side/aspect/first/leading/classifier for pigs or livestock/CL:個|个[ge4]
to follow fashion
to follow in other people's footsteps
to aim to carve a swan and get a semblance of a duck (idiom)/to fail utterly in trying to copy something/to get a reasonably good, if not perfect, result
follow the same old path (idiom); stuck in a rut/always the same routine
like ants pursuing a stink (idiom); the mob chases the rich and powerful/the crowd runs after trash
lit. the heart of a sheep in the skin of a tiger (idiom)/fig. impressive in appearance but lacking in substance/braggart
to pick up what others say (idiom); to pass off other people's opinions as one's own/to parrot
lit. to cling to the high, connect to the rich (idiom); to try to attach oneself to the rich and powerful/social climbing
if it's plowing, ask the laborer (idiom); when managing a matter, consult the appropriate specialist
conservative and unable to adapt (idiom)
see 方枘圓鑿|方枘圆凿[fang1 rui4 yuan2 zao2]
to cut the feet to fit the shoes (idiom); to force sth to fit (as to a Procrustean bed)/impractical or inelegant solution
to reject a word because of the speaker (idiom, from Analects); to judge on preference between advisers rather than the merits of the case
indiscriminately included in company (without any qualification)/see 濫竽充數|滥竽充数[lan4 yu2 chong1 shu4]
lit. see the wind and assume it will rain (idiom); fig. gullible/to believe whatever people suggest
to pander to sb's whims
